title: Inheritance In Java
summary: Inheritance is the process of taking one class and making it so that it extends the functionality of another. This means that the code that was implemented in the parent class can be used in the child class. This way, youâ€™ll have a single point of code where that functionality is defined and you can reuse it as many times as you want. If you want to reuse code that has been implemented in a different class, then you should use inheritance. This is just one of the reasons why you might want to take advantage of inheritance.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you think of classes and objects, what comes to mind? If your thoughts immediately went to the idea of parent and child classes, then you\u2019ve either studied object-oriented programming or you understand the nuances of English. However, if you think about a parent giving birth to a child, then you obviously haven\u2019t studied enough OOP. Let\u2019s see what inheritance in Java is all about and why it\u2019s useful.
We often find ourselves reusing code that has been implemented in some other class. This leads us to ask a very logical question \u2013 can we reuse code even further? The answer is yes! We can take one class and make it so that it extends the functionality of another. This is called inheritance in Java. It is one of the cornerstones of OOP programming and something that every serious programmer should know well.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Why Use Inheritance?"),mdx("p",null,`It is important to understand why inheritance is used at all. If you want to reuse existing code, you can always do so without inheriting anything. However, the problem is that if two different classes need the same functionality, you\u2019ll have to copy and paste that code in two different places. This is a bad practice and can lead to issues in the future.
The only way to avoid this is to use inheritance. You can create a base class that has all the shared functionality and then have all the child classes extend that base class. This way, you\u2019ll have a single point of code where that functionality is defined and you can reuse it as many times as you want.`),mdx("h2",null,"What is Inheritance in Java?"),mdx("p",null,`Inheritance is the process of taking one class and making it so that it extends the functionality of another. This means that the child class can use the parent class and vice versa.
This means that the code that was implemented in the parent class can be used in the child class.
In the end, this allows the creation of a \u201Cfamily tree\u201D of classes, where a child class can extend a parent class and inherit all of its functionality.`),mdx("h2",null,"When to Use Inheritance?"),mdx("p",null,`If you want to reuse code that has been implemented in a different class, then you should use inheritance.
However, this is just one of the reasons why you might want to take advantage of inheritance.
Now that you know what inheritance is and why it\u2019s used, it\u2019s time to learn when to use it.`),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Code Reuse - When you have a parent class that has all the functionality that you need in your child class, you can inherit from it. This way, you\u2019ll have a single point of code where that functionality is defined and you can reuse it as many times as you want.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Extending Existing Code - What if you have a parent class that has all the functionality that you need, but it isn\u2019t quite what you\u2019re looking for? In this case, you can inherit from it and then change or extend that code. This way, you\u2019ll have the best of both worlds. You\u2019ll get the functionality that you need from the parent class and the ability to make modifications to it.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Extendability - Inheritance is useful for more than just reusing code. It can also help you with your code\u2019s extendability. This refers to the flexibility of extending a class to add new functionality later on. In other words, you can add functionality to an existing class by creating a new class that inherits from it."))),mdx("h2",null,"Java Built-in Types that can be used as Constant"),mdx("p",null,"This is a list of the most common types that can be used as primitive constants."),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Boolean - This is the type that is used to represent true or false values.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Character - This type is used to represent one-letter strings.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Integer - This is the most common type used to represent whole numbers without decimals.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Long - This type is used to represent long numbers without decimals.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Float - This type is used to represent numbers with decimals.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Double - This is similar to float, but it has a slightly higher precision.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"String - This type is used to represent strings of characters."))),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,`Now you know the basics of inheritance, when and why you should use it. You\u2019ve also learned what types can be used as constants and how inheritance can help you create extendable code.
Of course, there\u2019s more to inheritance than what\u2019s been covered in this article. However, if you understand the basics, you\u2019ll be able to grasp the rest of it easily.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

Those who are tech-savvy are constantly on the lookout for new ways to grow their knowledge and advance their careers as developers. However, this can be a daunting task for many people because there are so many different programming languages available to learn.
With so many options out there, how do you know which ones are worth your time? That\u2019s why we\u2019ve compiled a list of some of the most popular programming languages that you should consider learning if you want to become a software developer. Although it may seem like there are endless possibilities, not every programming language is worth your time and effort. In this blog post, we\u2019ll explore why Python is ideal for software development and why it sets itself apart from other options such`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Coding Habits for Beginners

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"The road to becoming an expert coder is long and challenging. In fact, it\u2019s one of the most difficult tech fields to get started in as a beginner. But it\u2019s also one of the most lucrative careers you can choose to pursue. The average software engineer salary is around $100K per year, which is even more impressive when you consider that the average age of software engineers is only 29! If you want to start a new career in coding but feel like you\u2019re starting at square one, we have some advice for you. As someone who has been coding for over 10 years now, I can tell you with complete certainty that great coders are made and not born. Anyone can learn how to code if they are willing to work hard at it and adopt some good habits along the way. Here are some tips on how you can get started today:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Software engineers constantly have to stay up-to-date with new research, trends, and techniques in their field. The most common way for software engineers to do this is by reading research papers published in journals. These journals are almost exclusively found online. Many of them are available for free, but some are behind paywalls for non-subscribers. Fortunately, you don\u2019t need to subscribe to every single one of these journals if you\u2019re a software engineer\u2014just the ones that publish articles related to your specific interests and career goals as a software engineer.
Read on to learn more about the top software engineering journals so that you can pick which ones will help you excel as a software engineer!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of a Software Engineering Career

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...n}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...n,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Software engineers are responsible for developing new software or fixing existing code to make sure it meets user needs and performs as expected. They use logical thinking, problem-solving skills, and a variety of technical principles when they create and test software applications. As a software engineer, you could get the opportunity to work on projects that solve challenging problems. This career can help you gain new skills, advance your career, and build a more stable future for yourself. Let\u2019s take a closer look at why you should consider making a career in software engineering if you\u2019re interested in computer science or another STEM field.
Software engineers have some of the most dynamic jobs today because technology is changing so rapidly. But what exactly does it mean to be an engineer? Well, an engineer is someone who combines science with logical thinking and creativity to produce useful new ideas or innovations that meet human needs and challenges.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Coding Tutorials for Beginners

There are so many coding tutorials out there, it\u2019s easy to get lost. Some of them are too basic and some too advanced. Finding the right balance between too easy and too hard is tricky. That\u2019s why in this article you will find the best coding tutorials for beginners. From beginner level Python to intermediate HTML and CSS tutorials - you can learn all the essential skills of programming from these great resources. relatedArticles.title: How to Improve Your Coding Skills

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Whether you\u2019ve just started in the field of coding or are just looking to brush up on your skills, it can be a challenging and fast-growing field. New innovations in technology arise all the time, making it so that one must stay on top of their game to keep up. That being said, there are many different ways to improve your coding skills.
Coding is becoming an increasingly important skill across all industries. From software developers and engineers to website designers and video game programmers, more and more roles require knowledge of programming languages. Even if you don\u2019t plan on working with code directly on a day-to-day basis, having code literacy can open up opportunities for you in almost any industry. Read on for more information about how you can improve your coding skills and take your tech abilities to the next level.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Coding Shortcuts for Beginners

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In the beginning, coding can feel like solving puzzles with red-hot needles in your hands. Everything is new, nothing makes sense and you can\u2019t even tell if you are on the right track or not. It feels like one confusing labyrinth with a lot of locked doors \u2013 every time you find an unlocked door, it just leads to another locked door! How do we get out of this frustrating loop? Coding shortcuts!
A lot of coders will tell you that in order to be a successful coder, you need to know everything about coding and all its ins and outs. However, there is a reason why even experienced programmers take note of coding shortcuts. These little tricks make life easier for anyone who is just getting started with coding and doesn\u2019t have time to invest in learning every last bit of it before they can start creating useful programs.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Software engineers are the engine of the digital economy. They create, maintain and update the software that powers businesses, websites and apps. And demand for software engineers continues to grow. Job postings for software engineers have increased by 37 percent in the last five years, with an additional 26 percent increase expected by 2024.
Software engineering is also one of the most competitive fields to break into at the moment. There is a shortage of skilled candidates, which has led to high demand and high salaries for top software engineers who can drive innovation in their companies. To become a software engineer and land one of those coveted jobs, you will need to complete a computer science degree or take up coding classes. Let\u2019s take a look at what you need to become a software engineer and what the future might hold for this field.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Coding Tools for Developers

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Developers do a lot of work. As with any job, coders have to balance the amount of time spent coding as well as the quality and efficiency of that coding. It is an ongoing challenge to stay organized and productive throughout the day. The good news is that there are many tools out there that make the lives of developers easier. These tools make tasks like code organization, file sharing, debugging, and testing much simpler.
Coding tools help developers in multiple ways. They streamline processes such codification, debugging, testing, and management of code libraries. Additionally, these tools reduce redundancy and increase efficiency across projects and teams as a whole rather than individually. Let\u2019s take a look at some of the best coding tools that every developer should know about!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
